title: How to Make a Clown Costume

steps.headline: Find a white t-shirt or singlet top that can be transformed.
steps.description: You will be stitching or gluing this top, so make sure it's a top you don't want anymore.

steps.headline: Sew a row of really large and brightly colored buttons or pompoms down the center of the top.
steps.description: Vary each button's color, so that it looks very bright and colorful. If preferred, glue the buttons or pompoms in place.

steps.headline: Sew a length of ribbon down each front side of the top.
steps.description: Measure an equal distance on each side of the top for placement of the ribbon, then stitch in place. These ribbons represent the suspenders for the pants that clowns would wear to hold up their pants. If preferred, glue in place; just be sure to smooth out the ribbon to prevent wrinkling.

steps.headline: Sew (or glue) a bow tie in place.
steps.description: Center this under the chin area of the top, then stitch or glue in place. You can use a real bow tie or a more simple bow made from ribbon. Old bow ties can be sourced from thrift stores, grandpa's closet, etc.

steps.headline: Decide whether you wish to wear pants or a skirt.
If you chose pants:
steps.description: Find some baggy pants. These could be large sized pajama pants with spots on them, baggy pants with polka dots painted on them, or similar large-sized pants.

steps.headline: If you chose a skirt:
Choose shoes.
Add gloves.
steps.description: Although optional, this is a good addition, as it adds to the exaggerate effect. Wear white gloves, or rainbow colored gloves, for the best clown appearance.

steps.headline: Paint all of your face white.
steps.description: Use face-painting white paint for this purpose.

steps.headline: Exaggerate your facial features to portray the clown's emotions.
Add a red nose.
steps.description: Purchase a red nose from a costume store or online. Simply attach it in place with the elastic just before you finish dressing.

text:
Preparing the clown outfit Find a white t-shirt or singlet top that can be transformed. You will be stitching or gluing this top, so make sure it's a top you don't want anymore. Sew a row of really large and brightly colored buttons or pompoms down the center of the top. Vary each button's color, so that it looks very bright and colorful. If preferred, glue the buttons or pompoms in place. Sew a length of ribbon down each front side of the top. Measure an equal distance on each side of the top for placement of the ribbon, then stitch in place. These ribbons represent the suspenders for the pants that clowns would wear to hold up their pants. If preferred, glue in place; just be sure to smooth out the ribbon to prevent wrinkling. Sew (or glue) a bow tie in place. Center this under the chin area of the top, then stitch or glue in place. You can use a real bow tie or a more simple bow made from ribbon. Old bow ties can be sourced from thrift stores, grandpa's closet, etc. Decide whether you wish to wear pants or a skirt. Either is acceptable. If you chose pants: Find some baggy pants. These could be large sized pajama pants with spots on them, baggy pants with polka dots painted on them, or similar large-sized pants. If you chose a skirt: Wear a tutu. It is best bright and even better if multi-colored. Wear striped or colorful tights under the tutu. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Wear a skirt made from a range of ties. This type of skirt looks zany, fun and is ideal for a clown design. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Choose shoes. Clown shoes are usually over-sized and large. Finding real clown shoes might be difficult, so you can improvise in one of the following ways: Use a normal pair of shoes but add some cardboard ends. Draw large shoe-shaped ends from cardboard, paint them the same color as the shoes, then attach them to the end of the shoes with tape. This will only last one wear and if it's raining, they need to be covered in contact paper first, but they should suffice for a single wear. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use shoes that are a size or two larger than your normal shoes, preferring sandshoes, sneakers or other soft sports/beach style shoes. Tie them up tightly so that they don't come off your feet. Walk with care and do not run in them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Check online for clown shoe sales. There might be an affordable pair. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Wear ankle boots. Boots look bigger than shoes naturally, so they are ideal in place of the standard clown shoes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add gloves. Although optional, this is a good addition, as it adds to the exaggerate effect. Wear white gloves, or rainbow colored gloves, for the best clown appearance. Preparing your clown face Paint all of your face white. Use face-painting white paint for this purpose. Exaggerate your facial features to portray the clown's emotions. Paint a really large red mouth. It can either be smiling or frowning; the main thing is that it be larger than your actual lips. Be sure to really exaggerate the smile or frown, by making the ends of your mouth turn right up or right down. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Paint red rosy cheek circles, with red face paint. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use black face paint to make your eyes much larger or more obvious. You could paint black circles around them, paint really long eyelashes, darken your eyebrows to make them stand out, etc. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add other features as wished. For example, you might add a tear or cross sections through each of your eyes. Love hearts make a cute and more upbeat look. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e3/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e3/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add a red nose. Purchase a red nose from a costume store or online. Simply attach it in place with the elastic just before you finish dressing.
sentences: Preparing the clown outfit Find a white t-shirt or singlet top that can be transformed.
You will be stitching or gluing this top, so make sure it's a top you don't want anymore.
Sew a row of really large and brightly colored buttons or pompoms down the center of the top.
Vary each button's color, so that it looks very bright and colorful.
If preferred, glue the buttons or pompoms in place.
Sew a length of ribbon down each front side of the top.
Measure an equal distance on each side of the top for placement of the ribbon, then stitch in place.
These ribbons represent the suspenders for the pants that clowns would wear to hold up their pants.
If preferred, glue in place; just be sure to smooth out the ribbon to prevent wrinkling.
Sew (or glue) a bow tie in place.
Center this under the chin area of the top, then stitch or glue in place.
You can use a real bow tie or a more simple bow made from ribbon.
Old bow ties can be sourced from thrift stores, grandpa's closet, etc.
Decide whether you wish to wear pants or a skirt.
Either is acceptable.
If you chose pants: Find some baggy pants.
These could be large sized pajama pants with spots on them, baggy pants with polka dots painted on them, or similar large-sized pants.
If you chose a skirt: Wear a tutu.
It is best bright and even better if multi-colored.
Wear striped or colorful tights under the tutu.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/1\/10\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Wear a skirt made from a range of ties.
This type of skirt looks zany, fun and is ideal for a clown design.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b0\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Choose shoes.
Clown shoes are usually over-sized and large.

Finding real clown shoes might be difficult, so you can improvise in one of the following ways:
Use a normal pair of shoes but add some cardboard ends.
Draw large shoe-shaped ends from cardboard, paint them the same color as the shoes, then attach them to the end of the shoes with tape.
This will only last one wear and if it's raining, they need to be covered in contact paper first, but they should suffice for a single wear.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/d7\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use shoes that are a size or two larger than your normal shoes, preferring sandshoes, sneakers or other soft sports/beach style shoes.
Tie them up tightly so that they don't come off your feet.
Walk with care and do not run in them.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ae\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/ae\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Check online for clown shoe sales.
There might be an affordable pair.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/22\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Wear ankle boots.
Boots look bigger than shoes naturally, so they are ideal in place of the standard clown shoes.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/c6\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-8Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add gloves.
Although optional, this is a good addition, as it adds to the exaggerate effect.
Wear white gloves, or rainbow colored gloves, for the best clown appearance.
Preparing your clown face Paint all of your face white.
Use face-painting white paint for this purpose.
Exaggerate your facial features to portray the clown's emotions.
Paint a really large red mouth.
It can either be smiling or frowning; the main thing is that it be larger than your actual lips.
Be sure to really exaggerate the smile or frown, by making the ends of your mouth turn right up or right down.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Paint red rosy cheek circles, with red face paint.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/36\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Use black face paint to make your eyes much larger or more obvious.
You could paint black circles around them, paint really long eyelashes, darken your eyebrows to make them stand out, etc.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/eb\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add other features as wished.
For example, you might add a tear or cross sections through each of your eyes.
Love hearts make a cute and more upbeat look.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e3\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e3\/Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Clown-Costume-Step-11Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add a red nose.
Purchase a red nose from a costume store or online.
Simply attach it in place with the elastic just before you finish dressing.
